clinical_study.brief_title: Short Term Warfarin Therapy for Radiofrequency Catheter Ablation of Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Randomized Study of Incidence of Thromboembolic and Bleeding Events According to the Period of Warfarin Use Before and After Catheter Ablation of Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation in Low Risk Patients

brief_summary.textblock: We hypothesized that in patients with low CHADS-VASc score (2 or < 2), there is no difference in thromboembolic or bleeding events between patients with short term warfarin therapy (2 weeks after catheter ablation) and conventional therapy (3 weeks before and 8 weeks after procedure).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of thromboembolic and bleeding events during 2 months

arm_group.description: taking warfarin for only 2 weeks after catheter ablation of atrial fibrillation
conventional warfarin therapy of 3 weeks before and 8 weeks after catheter ablation of AF

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation who underwent radiofrequency catheter ablation
- Patients with CHADS-VASc score 2 or less than 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who do not consent to the study
- Permanent or persistent atrial fibrillation
- Patients who have underwent prior catheter ablation for atrial fibrillation
- CHADS-VASc score more than 2
- History of stroke
- LVEF <40%
- Significant liver or kidney dysfunction
- History of major bleeding during warfarin therapy
